widgets_values:
For default value:
"-1" (i.e. not in range): Randomize within the min and max value range. 
in range: Fixed, always the same value

- **Original**: Requires about 32GB of VRAM.

nodes.title: Flux Kontext Prompt Techniques
widgets_values:
## Flux Kontext Prompt Techniques

### 1. Basic Modifications
- Simple and direct: `"Change the car color to red"`
- Maintain style: `"Change to daytime while maintaining the same style of the painting"`

### 2. Style Transfer
**Principles:**
- Clearly name style: `"Transform to Bauhaus art style"`
- Describe characteristics: `"Transform to oil painting with visible brushstrokes, thick paint texture"`
- Preserve composition: `"Change to Bauhaus style while maintaining the original composition"`

### 3. Character Consistency
**Framework:**
- Specific description: `"The woman with short black hair"` instead of "she"
- Preserve features: `"while maintaining the same facial features, hairstyle, and expression"`
- Step-by-step modifications: Change background first, then actions

### 4. Text Editing
- Use quotes: `"Replace 'joy' with 'BFL'"`
- Maintain format: `"Replace text while maintaining the same font style"`

## Common Problem Solutions

### Character Changes Too Much
âŒ Wrong: `"Transform the person into a Viking"`
âœ… Correct: `"Change the clothes to be a viking warrior while preserving facial features"`

### Composition Position Changes
âŒ Wrong: `"Put him on a beach"`
âœ… Correct: `"Change the background to a beach while keeping the person in the exact same position, scale, and pose"`

### Style Application Inaccuracy
âŒ Wrong: `"Make it a sketch"`
âœ… Correct: `"Convert to pencil sketch with natural graphite lines, cross-hatching, and visible paper texture"`

## Core Principles

1. **Be Specific and Clear** - Use precise descriptions, avoid vague terms
2. **Step-by-step Editing** - Break complex modifications into multiple simple steps
3. **Explicit Preservation** - State what should remain unchanged
4. **Verb Selection** - Use "change", "replace" rather than "transform"

## Best Practice Templates

**Object Modification:**
`"Change [object] to [new state], keep [content to preserve] unchanged"`

**Style Transfer:**
`"Transform to [specific style], while maintaining [composition/character/other] unchanged"`

**Background Replacement:**
`"Change the background to [new background], keep the subject in the exact same position and pose"`

**Text Editing:**
`"Replace '[original text]' with '[new text]', maintain the same font style"`

> **Remember:** The more specific, the better. Kontext excels at understanding detailed instructions and maintaining consistency.

If you get an error in any of the nodes above make sure the files are in the correct directories.

See the examples page for the links : https://comfyanonymous.github.io/ComfyUI_examples/flux/

flux1-kontext-dev.safetensors goes in: ComfyUI/models/unet/

t5xxl_fp16.safetensors and clip_l.safetensors go in: ComfyUI/models/clip/

ae.safetensors goes in: ComfyUI/models/vae/


Tip: You can set the weight_dtype above to one of the fp8 types if you have memory issues.

YOU NEED TO SET THE SECRETS ON THE MACHINE OR YOUR ENVS ON THE pc

IF there is no OPENAI_API_KEY on the machine secrets. You will need to enter your full prompt and delete the AI_SYSTEM_PROMPT  

Otherwise you can use this to add a The Task to be preform by the model for example "replace the cat from image1 with the dog on image2" 

she is wearing the same clothes but it has the logo on the swimsuit make sure it looks well integrated and part of the same material with the fabric and not just an overlay the logo should wrap with the swinsuit to the body of the model

You are a prompt engineer for FLUX.1 Kontext. Inputs: USER_PROMPT text; IMG1 required; IMG2 optional (scene, second subject, or style reference). Decide the best task automatically based on the user USER_PROMPT and the images (1) Subjectâ†’Scene Replacement if IMG2 is a scene or USER_PROMPT says replace/cast/put A into B; (2) Dual-Subject Integration if combining two subjects and using background from IMG1 or IMG2 per USER_PROMPT; (3) Style Transfer if a style is requested or IMG2 is a style ref; (4) Background Replacement if only the scene changes; (5) Text Edit if quoted text is to be changed; (6) Basic Modifications otherwise. Output EXACTLY ONE numbered line (1-1), one line only, 80â€“120 words, using explicit nouns (no pronouns) and pipes "|" as separators. Builders: Subjectâ†’Scene â†’ "Replace: describe the person in IMG2 to be replaced â†’ With: concise identity from IMG1 (face/eyes/hair, distinctive marks, outfit colors/materials, rendering style e.g., anime/3D/photoreal) | Pose: match IMG2 pose/orientation/expression | Composition: keep IMG2 camera angle, FOV, scale, background, props, on-image text unchanged | Style & Lighting: keep IMG2 scene grade; harmonize shadows/reflections/perspective | Preservation: keep IMG1 identity exactly; change nothing else | Video: apply consistently across frames." Dual-Subject â†’ "Place: concise identity from IMG1 and concise identity from IMG2 together | Background: use background from <IMG1 or IMG2 per USER_PROMPT> unchanged | Poses: keep original poses/eyelines | Composition: keep chosen background camera angle/FOV/perspective; respect occlusions/props | Style & Lighting: unify lighting/shadows/color grade; avoid style clash | Preservation: keep both identities exactly; change nothing else." Style Transfer â†’ "Restyle to <named style/artist/movement> with defining traits <brief>; keep original composition/object placement and subject identity unchanged; preserve lighting where relevant." Background Replacement â†’ "Change the background to <setting>; keep the subject in the exact same position, scale, and pose; maintain identical camera angle, framing, and perspective; only replace the environment." Text Edit â†’ "Replace '<original text>' with '<new text>' while maintaining the same font style/size/color and layout." Basic â†’ "Change <object/attribute> to <new state> while keeping <elements to preserve> unchanged." Rules: be specific; protect identity and composition; prefer "change/replace" over vague "transform"; keep within 512 tokens; if sequence/video, require temporal consistency.

2) Place: image of G.I. Joe style action figure from IMG1 and real-life actress from IMG2 together | Background: use neutral gray studio backdrop from IMG1 unchanged | Poses: maintain action-ready stance and eyeline between figures; align scale so both appear in same frame | Composition: keep camera angle and focal length consistent; preserve on-image text and logos from IMG1; ensure occlusions/props respect continuity | Style & Lighting: unify lighting direction and color grade to photorealistic blend; remove cartoon shading; harmonize shadows/reflections | Preservation: retain each identity exactly; no alteration to facial features or outfits; apply consistently across frames if sequence.
